the strangest customers you meet that are rude to the bone but you have to smile and shake it off because of Trader Joe's "customer experience" policy

too much heavy lifting. they say you'll get used to it, but your body is literally just breaking down and numbing itself from the pain

shift hours suck. you want to switch up your schedule because you have a life outside of Trader Joe's? too bad. you signed up for it, you gotta work it for about three months then maybe you can switch to a more suitable shift. I'm not saying that it's unfair, but there are circumstances beyond control. It'd be nice to show some compassion.

headline: @48 years old it's my favorite job...ever.
pros:
excellent salary
phenomenal benefits
family-like work atmosphere
integrity of company & products
ability to be paid/valued well for being:
genuine
hard-working
creative
organized
self-motivated
and physically active

insurance premiums have not gone up for employees since 2010. company absorbed all increases instead of passing them along to their employees.
cons: retail = no "real" weekends

headline: Trader Joe's Crew Member
pros: Great atmosphere, great pay, paid time off and health insurance for part time employees, work isn't too difficult.
cons: Hours can be difficult and unpleasant, but this is the case with any retail position.

headline: Its fine
pros: Its a job. It can pay pretty well for what it is, if you're there for a long, long time.
cons: People tend to put TJ's on a pedestal. There's not a wonderland. Its just groceries.

headline: Crew/Mate
pros: Great benefits. Feels like working with a family
cons: Sometime middle management can be overlooked. Promotion can somewhat be a popularity contest.

headline: Horrible experience
pros: The wine is good. Everything is fairly cheap. The employees are nice and friendly. Everything is always clean and organized.
cons: Management is horrible. It's a blessing I didn't get hired. Management doesn't know how to tell people hey, we picked someone else. Took FOREVER to get back to me.

headline: Good retail but still retail.
pros:
Great co-workers with a good attitude

Flexible hours that accommodate your schedule. 

The schedule is made three weeks in advance which allow you to coordinate your life. 

Great benefits package for retail. 

Good pay for retail. 

Opportunities for advancement if you are interested.
cons:
Trader Joe's would like to think it's not corporate and operates on a no bureaucracy system. However, its corporate side will rear its ugly head every once and while and create high tensions among the crew.  


The biggest con of Trader Joe's is their denial to deal with real issues. If a serious issue comes up it is constantly downplayed. This includes forms of harassment, I experienced a sexual harassment seminar that was a complete joke and seemed to make both male and female employees more uncomfortable (Crew does have high respect for one another and most times harassment isn't an issue). Trader Joe's is more concerned with maintaining a friendly and positive illusion than actually maintaining the morale of its crew.

headline: Sign Artist
pros: Benefits, Paid Time off, Bi-annual opportunity for raises, fun working environment, employee discount on merchandise, and flexible schedule.
cons: Physical strain, rude customers, lazy coworkers, workplace hazards, cramped back storage room, indecisive management, and lack of communication.

headline: great
pros: tiring but fun and overall satisfying
cons: cons would be all the organic good food

headline: Good Company, Decent Benefits, Lackluster Management
pros:
- Excellent benefits
- Compensation can be fairly decent if you stay long enough
- Job duties are constantly revolving throughout the day, so you don't get stuck doing one mindless task for eight hours
- You get to ditch business suits in favor of Hawaiian shirts
- Everyone loves the products and stores, so customers are generally happy to be shopping there
- Company generally hires good people with a positive attitude, so most coworkers are fun to be around
- EXTREMELY flexible with scheduling
cons:
- Company settles on poor performers and punishes the hard workers when they slip up only once.
- Every "Mate" (manager) has their own way of doing things, so miscommunication is a problem
- Biannual performance reviews are biased and managers often choose one irrelevant fault to prevent workers from getting a raise
- Unless you start at a decent wage, it will take eons to earn enough raises to earn a respectable income

headline: Crew Member
pros: The workplace culture is phenomenal. Very team and goal oriented.
cons: You tend to work either closing or opening shifts. Not much flexibility in schedule.

headline: Awesome place to work for!
pros: Great place to work for!
cons: Not much Cons about Trader Joe's

headline: Discrimination
pros: A very racial and bypass company.
cons: Very dishonest company, bypass toward women.

headline: Good first job
pros: Decent starting pay, good benefits
cons: Forced to have an open schedule in order to get shifts, very inconsistent scheduling

headline: One of the Best Companies in its Niche
pros: Positive, high-energy environment; eclectic, diverse, crew; strong sense of company culture; decent pay compared to market; flexible scheduling; college friendly; physical, uncomplicated work; better than average raises; rotation of duties; minimal micromanagement; good management structure; employee discount; easy access to affordable, nutritious food; product knowledge through sampling encouraged; major holidays off or with modified schedule; fun in-store events; accessible; employment irrespective of age; high level of employee privacy; worker appreciation; job security
cons: High degree of employee freedom and job security can be abused; stratification of work load by shift; strong shift division

headline: Mate
pros:
Positive atmosphere
Will make friends for life
cons:
Can get hurt on job
Low morale

headline: Control Center Lead
pros: To pay bill my bills and eat.
cons: Treat employees horrible.  Very unprofessional

headline: Fantastic company with an awesome workplace culture
pros:
- Company culture is warm fun & welcoming, no matter what store you go to 
- Everyone is paid above minimum wage based on their experience & value they add to the company
- Great benefits
- I am always happy to come to work
cons: - It is tiring if you aren't used to it, you've got to be able to lift about 50-75 pounds

headline: Fun yet stressful
pros: Great coworkers, amazing products, loyal customers and caring management. They also are flexible with availability and take your interests into consideration.
cons: It's a joke among customers that the parking lots are small and so are the stores. However that's not a joke, it's true! It's even worse to deal with as an employee, especially during holidays. This causes stress among customers and crew workers alike.

headline: Server
pros: I had an amazing experience at Traders. Everyone loved what they did and the quality of work was always interesting.
cons: There's not much to say here but probably better pay.

headline: Lovely place to work
pros: They teach you how to do everything when you start, so you can find out what you're good at and what you enjoy, and then you specialize from there. Everyone takes turns on reg, fostering a great sense of team camaraderie. I loved it.
cons: The hours can be tough- 3:30-midnight shifts for new hires, and wear comfortable shoes because you are always on your feet!

headline: Crew member
pros: Positive environment, healthy food, good people to work with
cons: Hard work, lots of lifting

headline: Crew
pros: Very friendly team and management. There are promotions every 6 months. You also get great benefits.
cons: You have to be friendly to all customers, but sometimes it gets too much when you have a very rude customer, which ruins the experience.

headline: Trader Joes offers great work atmosphere!
pros: Great co-workers, great potential, great benefits
cons: Not many cons..but there can be obvious "golden" child or two.

headline: Love Love Love!
pros:
Trader Joe's is a  fantastic company that lavishly rewards their employees, genuinely cares about their well-being and is an outrageously fun place to work! 

Great team work, fun work environment, fantastic products! Work is varied and great energy and atmosphere in the store!

Great pay, benefits and discounts!!!
cons: Schedule is not consistent and hard to plan for personal life.  Training can be inconsistent going from trainer to trainer. Program great otherwise , very hard to find cons with TJ! Otherwise great!

headline: Crew Member
pros: we got free Coffee and Samples
cons: No Cons, I enjoyed working here

headline: One of my favorite places I've ever worked!
pros: Always snacks in the breakroom, 10% discount on everything (including wines), the people you work with are genuinely the most friendly, interesting people, the customers are really kind and personable.
cons: You're on your feet 99% of the time you're at work! Which can be seen as a good thing. Sometimes scheduling isn't ideal, but hey it's a job.

headline: Crew Member
pros: I have always worked with really great people, peers and management alike.  The best part about the job was all of the friendships that I had created and the people surrounding me really made the job worth it and enjoyable.
cons: Upper management (outside of the store level) has really gotten away from the neighborhood grocery store feel.  They used to genuinely care about employees and now they are one corporate conglomerate, out to make as much money as possible.  It has sucked A LOT of morale out of every store.  They also did away with a hierarchy, which is usually a good thing, but for those who want to move up within the company, there really is nowhere to go.

headline: Crew Member
pros: Awesome co-workers (for the most part), good benefit package, great place if you enjoy food
cons: I think it's changed, but night shift always worked passed midnight, lack of synergy between managers

headline: Average Job
pros: Ok Benefits, fun people, always a different day each day. Cool customers to interact with on a day to day basis
cons: The manager at my location was always on everyone's case and providing unnecessary pressure. Some days we'd be scheduled to come at ridiculous hours.

headline: Great place to work if you're looking for a part-time job
pros: The work at Trader Joe's is incredibly rewarding. Being able to interact with customers everyday is an incredibly uplifting job.
cons: Like most part time employment, the compensation is low.

headline: Great company
pros:
I started at Trader Joe's about 2 months ago. And so far everyone has been super nice and for the most part seems to pull their own weight. 
A lot less slackers than normal retail/grocery stores.
Better than average pay and raises
Discount which isn't given many places anymore.
Super nice and actually happy managers and employees.
cons:
Each Trader Joe's is individually run so they standards at other stores may vary. I've never work at another one so I'm not sure.
No pay on holidays ( but with above avg rates and they give you a gift card in the mail from time to time it tends to balance out)
Managers work 10 hour shifts and I've been told can be transferred (within the state) without much notice.

headline: Great job + Great benefits
pros: Loved working here! Raise every 6 months, free gym membership, 401k, paid time off, great crew, etc. The list goes on.
cons: Rude customers, shift periods, hard to stay on a diet with all this delicious food hanging around!

headline: Great work environment
pros: Great work environment. There's a focus on teamwork and everyone helps each other out. Having fun on the job is encouraged. Managers are generally very understanding and you can always talk to someone if you have a problem. The #1 company value is integrity, and it shows.
cons: Cons are those of all retail jobs: schedule and pay. It is also fairly physical, so could be a problem depending on fitness level / chronic health issues.

headline: Good place to work
pros: Pays a bit above average, good benefits after 3 months, paid time off for everyone, free dental and vision after 3 months, nice co-workers
cons: first shifts start at 4 am and end at 11-12 pm. can be rough for certain people

headline: Crew Member
pros: Great company to work for. Upbeat, fun environment while keeping it professional when it comes to customer service. Great benefits when you're there as a full time worker.
cons: Not a set schedule but depending on the schedule writer they can be flexible with time and hours.

headline: Employed since 1995!
pros: Fun place to work. Physical job that is low stress. Healthy and positive environment. Happy customers too. Lots of love.
cons: Customers know we have small parking lots. Less monthly rent payments helps keep prices low. Just have to know when to shop and maybe walk to the store whenever you can.

headline: DC Trader Joe's is solid
pros: The coworkers are solid. They are hardworking individuals who are cut from all walks of life. The diversity shows in the dynamics of the crew.
cons: The DC stores get hit pretty hard due to their volume. Additionally, the local volume can be on the needy side especially when the line runs long or products run out.

headline: Crew memeber
pros: Fun, high energy place to work with amazingly grateful and appreciative management. Great customers; there is a certain customer base and the majority of them appreciate the employees and our eccentricities, and we are eccentric!
cons: If I have to give you a con....and it has nothing to do with TJ's.....it has to do with customers missing the toilet and having to clean that up!

headline: Crew Member
pros: Co-workers, Management, daily tastings, food recipes, wine tasting, discount, 401k and benefits.
cons: the general public can be difficult at times but also rewarding.  Job can be strenuous at times and you are not rewarded for your work ethic.  Everyone gets the same raise as long as you meet the minimum standards.

headline: overall a great place to be.
pros: High pay for a retail job, great healthcare benefits, very friendly managers, positive environment
cons: small pay raises, computers are very slow and aged, as are the registers, Product ordering system is archaic and very unreliable, Terrible communication between the company and product warehouses.

headline: Crew Member
pros: Outstanding work environment, fun people to work with and for
cons: Honestly, can't really think of any

headline: Trader Joe's
pros:
Good pay
Nice people
You get to be active and engage in conversation
cons:
A lot of hard work
They give the younger people the worst hours

headline: Cashier (mate)
pros: The ability to have freedom working in the store you were never only working just the register, their company philosophy is diversification in all areas of the company.
cons: Work is priority, with that being said, I was able to get time off for finals when attending school.

headline: Crew member
pros: Flexible schedules, active work, a dedicated schedule for pay raises and opportunity for advancement
cons: Managers don't seem to always value a crew members time in regards to their in-store obligations. Artists are ten away from making art to work the register, section leaders aren't given enough time to fully work audit their sections, etc.

headline: Great Company
pros: Benefits, Pay, people who work there are nice, management is nice, more of a team, care about employees, try to work with you
cons: transferring out a store, working the cash register too much, customers feel so entitled

headline: Crew Member
pros: Positive work environment, regular raises for good performance, dental and vision benefits for part-time workers, dental, vision, and medical benefits for full-time workers, 10% discount on all merchandise, ability to transfer between stores, employee assistance program, and annual contribution to a company and employee funded retirement account.
cons: Work conditions can be cramped and injuries are common. Shifts can vary greatly as to when they are scheduled, and sometimes workers are only given 8 hours between shifts. The work can become mundane for those who have been with the company for many years.

headline: signage artist
pros: creative work, up beat environment and pretty nice people. The pay was ok and enjoyed the discounts on food.
cons: poor working conditions, lack of space and no ventilation from chemicals and markers and refrigeration. I felt like I was working in a closet with no AC or Heat with 2 an 3 other people sometimes. I literally had to go work outside in the elements at times. Management wouldn't help fix problem since higher ups didn't want to do anything about it.

headline: Mate
pros: discount, fun atmosphere, yummy food
cons: some times it's really busy

headline: Super Bad Management
pros: Not that many great things to Highlight. Fair pay, if you can get the hours. Trader joes has good products and wine.
cons: I was not learning very much except how to B.S. the customers and always Smile. Many Customers are very RUDE and complain about everything. The Management is unbelievable and kept hiring young inexperienced people to run the store and placed them into assistant Management roles. The Captain only promoted his lazy friends. It's amazing how that person ever became Captain.

headline: fun job
pros: We're a family at trader joe's. The job itself is alright, but the fun part is how much fun that you can have with coworkers. We can have way too much fun while getting stuff done. I'm on my 4th store & 9 years in. You can make friends for life here.
cons: Some managers micro manage. You have to deal with crazy and rude customers at times. Job can get tedious.

headline: Crew Member
pros: Fun work environment! Provided food and refreshments periodically.
cons: Micromanagement, a lack of upward mobility, and an extremely bureaucratic system.

headline: Good place to work overall
pros: The benefits are really nice. The job can get very physically intense. I personally do yoga do everyday; now I do my yoga just to help undo the work done on my body. Management can be super open when it comes to help/criticism
cons: Physical damage. You do have to have a high emotional intelligence to provide the service needed. Which also drains you completely

headline: Trader Joes
pros:
Good benefits
Fun job
Meet interesting co-workers and customers.
Pay is good for longtime workers and managers.
Stable employment.  
Company continues to grow.
cons:
Not everyone has the same work ethic and values.  
Poor work/life balance - especially for management. 
The turn around shifts are mentally and physically draining which can increase the chance of injury and mistakes.

headline: Crew Member
pros: Great benefits, great colleagues, very active/energetic work. Hours are fairly flexible; you can usually get a regular schedule if the store's needs don't get in the way (and they sometimes do). Pay for regular crew members is capped at about 22/hr. They do promote from within (if you make the effort), and pay ceilings rise accordingly.
cons: Retail. It can be tough, especially in wealthier neighborhoods where the people have a greater sense of entitlement, are more arrogant & pushy.

headline: Great Place for Students
pros: Worked here throughout some of high school and all of college. Very flexible hours, with great benefits and pay.
cons: Some of upper management seemed to show a highly favorable attitude towards some crew members, while ignoring the needs of other crew members.

headline: Crew
pros: This store is amazing, the company takes very good care of us. I enjoy the type of people we hire and our customers are great as well. So many people complain about dealing with customers in other retail places but I can honestly say our customers are special. Benefits and wage are very livable as well. Full medical after 30hrs for your whole family is 216/mo with a low deductible! Pay is very livable,(negotiate with them), raises every six months and 10% retirement contribution! Also vacation pay accruals as soon as you start. Also you can be a fitbit champion, average 5 miles each shift.
cons: It is a very physical job, prepare to frequently lift 40lb boxes in sometimes precarious fashion. Also tons of walking (which I think is great), and the whole shift is spent on your feet (I love it but some might not be able to handle). If you get hired here buy the best shoes you can, you will not regret it! Also it is great if your outgoing but the engagement required, both with customers and crew may make some introverts uncomfortable.

headline: crew member
pros: people are nice, atmosphere is also nice and management is understanding. The starting pay is usually good and it is an easy job
cons: too many mangers for a small store and dealing with customers is annoying at times. Also its 2 weeks notice for taking a day off which i think is too much

headline: Good benefits but hard on the body
pros: Pay is low..treated well...work is brutal on the body..Everyone injured
cons: See above same as here

headline: Overall A Good Place To Work
pros:
Great co-workers
Positive environment
Flexible schedule
Good pay and benefits
cons: New management brought negative changes and more focus on money. Hours are sometimes cut without warning.

headline: Traders
pros:
Great atmosphere
raise every 6 months
Pay
cons: Too many bosses to run a small grocery store

headline: Crew member
pros: flexible schedule, great benefit, great environment to work at.
cons: Nothing that i can think of at the moment

headline: Liked it
pros: Was great working there nice people
cons: Nothing really to say. Ad

headline: Doesn't Care About Employees
pros: Work is simple, easy, and customers are usually happy.
cons: They care more about pointless corporate guidelines and less about common sense.

headline: Crew Member
pros: Great working environment.  Incredible benefits which many crew members don't understand.  Flexible schedules with accrued time off,
cons: Mates need to understand their job description.  Educating and mentoring.  Not happening.

headline: Recent Mate Promotion
pros: Hands down the most fun I've ever had at any job, and I was in the U.S. Navy.  You get to try all the new food items, wine, and beer when they arrive at the store.   The people that work at Trader's are one-of-a-kind.  If you shop there, you already know.  Part-time employees get two performance reviews a year.  That means twice a year you can get a pay raise.  The benefits are fantastic.  PPO for managers and a solid HMO for part-timers (non-management crew members).  Vision and dental included.  Thorough training for all crew members and periodic development training for management.
cons:
Retail hours: nights and weekends.
Management regularly gets moved around to different stores.
Wage to management is very small.
10-hour shifts that are on a "waterfall" schedule (start time is earlier as the week goes on).

headline: It's ok
pros: decent pay, good food, tastings
cons: no chance of getting promoted, very boring, they take creepy notes on you and put it in a file

headline: Crew Member
pros: Good People, Keeps you busy
cons: It's like high school but with older people. Your body starts to wear down after a while

headline: This will probably be one of your most fun jobs!
pros: Great people! Everyone there is basically one big family. Fun place!
cons: Hard to deal with customers sometimes as with any retail job.

headline: Great Company
pros: Benefits, environment, products, company values
cons: retail hours, back and body injuries

headline: Crew Member
pros: Great place to work and friendly employees
cons: Hours are not always the same.

headline: Awesome
pros: a outstanding place to work and enjoy good customers, hard work and great product
cons: not enough stores to relocate

headline: Crew Member
pros:
Great group of peopl
Relaxed atmosphere
cons: Bagging groceries is not ideal

headline: Great company to work for
pros: Worked as a crew member for 2 years. Trader Joe's was a great company to work for. I've never had a problem with any of my co-workers or managers and I had a flexible schedule while going to school. I never needed health insurance when I worked with them, but my co-workers seemed to like their benefits package.
cons: The only downside was having to work the register all the time, but I realize that you need to start somewhere. No cons otherwise.

headline: A good company
pros: Great company benefits, promotes from within, stable, flexible--with a variety of opportunities (with the right Captain), not stuck doing only one thing all day, great products, free tastings and coffee (makes a huge difference), educates you on all the products or makes that information easily accessible. In New York, they consistently give our raises to everyone who passes their reviews. Also, work environment geared towards positive reinforcement and almost NEVER FIRES ANYONE (it's nearly impossible).
cons: Management is a mixed bag (UNDERSTATEMENT. You need to know who's there to help you and who's there to serve themselves). I have some real issues over the years with some people who didn't really want to help their crew and I got screwed in the process. Also: poor intra-store communication, is not transparent about salaries. Scheduling is somewhat limited. This might sound exceptional to this company, but really these are very small issues if you've ever worked around in various retail companies. They are by far the best experience I've had in "the business".

headline: Union is coming
pros: We need it union now and soon
cons: Pay stinks for the work you do

headline: Nice part time job for
pros: Friendly work environment, casual dress, some co-workers were a bit odd.
cons: There were none for me

headline: Great company to work for
pros: It was a good experience. They are nice and friendly. Good opportunity for advancement.
cons: Lower salary as a graduate. Lower salary as a graduate. Lower salary as a graduate.Lower salary as a graduate. Lower salary as a graduate.

headline: Great job, most of the time.
pros:
Great benefits
Room to grow
Company culture
Competitive pay
cons:
Hard labor most times
Hours all over the place
Abuse from customers
Barely any over time

headline: Crew Member
pros:
- Work with a supporting team.
- Almost always a pleasure to walk into work
- Management is always supportive
cons:
- Customers can be demanding and entitled
- A lot of stress on the body if you are in a busy location
- Always on your feet

headline: Great Job
pros: Benefits are fantastic and very competitive. Coworkers are supportive and friendly.
cons: Hard, physical work that can take its toll on the body.

headline: It's cool...
pros: Decent pay, good people, you get to try lots of food, the customers are nice
cons: Hard work, odd hours, some people don't work hard, some people aren't as nice

headline: Generally a happy fun place with a few challenges.
pros: Pay is above average, good health benefits & fun co-workers.  Definitely one of the best retail places to work.  You have fun with a lot of the customers.
cons: Not given enough time to complete some tasks.  Scheduling can be unfair & management needs to listen to crew members a lot more.  We need a break besides lunch (red dot) without being frowned upon.

headline: Overall Good Company
pros: Great benefits, pretty good pay considering it's retail, reviews every 6 months, opportunity to move up, flexible schedules.
cons: You will work weekends. It's shift work, so your schedule wont' always be the same. Typical politics you find in every job. Each store is different as far as the management. Some stores have poor management, some have great.

headline: Overall good
pros: Benefits, fun environment, easy workflow day in and day out, happy customers daily
cons: Babysitting adults, dishonesty of employees,

headline: Good place to work
pros: Awesome atmosphere, fun to work for, great management, salaries of crew members can go high if you are loyal.
cons: Early hours can be draining, late night shifts takes you away from your families, very physical.

headline: Nice people, bad training
pros: Good starting pay for retail, decent benefits, able to "sample" products throughout the day, large focus on keeping employees happy
cons: Received minimal training before I was thrown onto the floor. Was given about 30 minutes of training for each section before I was expected to manage/restock it on my own, the week of Thanksgiving. Managers gave me a hard time for being slow without realizing I was training myself as I went due to the incompetency of the training I received.

headline: Changing to quickly?
pros: Trader Joe's has great benefits and pays very well, especially if you've been around a while. Two days off together and rotation of days off every 3-4 months- a weekend day off every 3 or 4 rotations,
cons: Long hours, company focuses on crew engagement too much. Feels as though the tail is wagging the dog at times.

headline: Hard work, sometimes rewarding
pros: Job tasks change throughout the day to help alleviate stress and frustration.  Good hiring means you work with mostly cool people. Yummy products to sample.  Customers normally are happy to be shopping at Tjs.
cons: Physically taxing and breaks down the body.  Even people who don't work hard get the same raise as you do.  Our store lacks good managerial direction and tight storage areas are unsafe.  One of the company values is to wow the customers, yet no one cares about wowing the employees.

headline: So glad I left horrible "stock market" value corporate world for TJs
pros: you work with, and for people who appreciate you, sounds like not worth that much does it? well try being in corporate world in the age of "we only care about stock price" and you will see the light, believe me, I was. Flexible hours, yes,its physical work and you move constantly, but sit at a desk for 8 hours in the corporate world and you will know what that does to body and soul over years. TJs remains a rare company that treats people as humans, that is no minor fact.
cons: a match on 401K would be nice, there is a 401K which is good, but a matching contribution would be nice as option.

headline: Occasionally an extension of high school
pros: Before the restructure and massive expansion working at TJs was a pleasure, but as things changed growing pains were felt.
cons: It became more and more like an extension of high school, in almost every aspect. Management decides on favorites and those who aren't so blessed know it quickly.

headline: A great place to work!
pros: Good management, co-workers, team atmosphere, even during the busy weekends.
cons: Retail works has its share of cons and Trader Joe's is no different than other retail companies.

headline: Crew Member
pros:
Great team of individuals
good pay
good benefits if you meet hour requirements
crew tastings - who doesn't like free food
cons: Varying day/times needed for work, but it's retail so that makes sense.

headline: Bittersweet
pros: I developed an undersranding of just how important it is to collaborate with all employees in reaching a common end goal (the pay was good too).
cons: I felt it extremely difficult to fit in as I was an external management hire.

headline: Awesome place to work
pros: Friendly coworkers and managers. Good benefits.
cons: I have none so far.

headline: Company Expectation
pros: It's a very friendly working environment. Your coworkers will always be friendly and happy to help. The benefits are plentiful. Vacation time accumulates immediately upon hire and all health benefits(health, dental, vision, become available after 3 months. An open work environment to all different types of people.
cons: The job can be labor intensive, so it's important to know how to avoid injury and stretch often. Sometimes you are given late hours up to 12 midnight and on if you give an open availability.

headline: Ft Merchant review
pros: Great people, highly motivated crew, and proactive approach to customer and crew concerns. Good benefits, good products to sell. Very competitive wages and flexible hours. Excellent room for advancement.
cons: The flexible hours can be a double edge sword and can be pretty early or late with short turnarounds. Expectations are high for a grocery store, if you just want a paycheck with little to no responsibility, then this is not the place for you.

headline: Crew
pros: You don't sit in just one place. Have you do everything in the store so you feel like you're moving
cons: the discount is only 10% off groceries. That just covers Tax.

headline: Great College Job
pros: Met great friends and had fun.
cons: Became a corporate owned place. Really hard not to get in trouble

headline: Great job while in school
pros: Great job while in school. They worked around my many schedule changes.
cons: Customers can be rude and you have to learn to ignore it. Also the job is extremely physical.

headline: Crew Member
pros: Great co workers, great customers, managers treat you with the upmost respect. There's a lot of store events that really helps camaraderie and community building within the store.
cons: I would like more opportunities for employees that go above and beyond. There are some that take it a little easier than others.

headline: Not a bad job but very political
pros: Decent money (starts around $10/hour), good store discount, cool co-workers, nice environment, you are always working on different tasks which reduces boredom
cons: Political environment caused by some full-time crew members who think they run the show. The management tends to capitulate. Also they recently reduced benefits and pay across the board.

headline: Nice working atmosphere, but very physically demanding.
pros: The great atmosphere is largely due to the tone set by management. They employ "positive reinforcement" and encourage employees to succeed. The company also does well in providing a great benefits package, including medical, dental, and retirement plans.
cons: This is a very a physically demanding job. Unfortunately, injuries are commonplace. Trader Joe's does its best at informing and enforcing proper lifting techniques and safety guidelines, but due to the strenuous and demanding toll the job requires out of one's body, injuries are bound to happen.

headline: Mate
pros:
-Benefits are amazing
-You really feel like you're a part of a small family
-Discounts on groceries are helpful
cons:
-You work all the time...rarely had a weekend or day off
-Not enough pay for the amount work and time you put into the job
-Managers get an hour lunch break but the rest of employees only got 30mins. The jobs are exhausting & the employees deserve an hour lunch break
-Hardly off on holidays

headline: trader Joe's employee
pros: great insurance and other benefits, fun place to work at, would be able to get a lot of call outs if ever needed, flexible with your schedule, great place to work if your  part time student, coworkers and managers are always there to help you.
cons: a lot of lifting needed, a very exhausting job, there's gonna be a lot of rude customers, backstabbers( depends on where it is)

headline: Great for Students
pros: I have worked at Trader Joe's for three years and it has been a great job while I am a student. They are flexible with my schedule and it is a great work environment.
cons: This job can be hard on your body because you are lifting boxes all day long. I am also 5'2" so I constantly have to get a ladder to stock the higher shelves. My store also sells wine so when I work the wine load it can be tiring. My store is a high volume store so we get very busy on the weekends and during the holidays.

headline: A company that cares
pros: Undoubtedly the best company I've ever worked for, they truly care about their employees. Captain, Mates and Section leaders promote a positive work environment.
cons: The Kaizen philosophy can sometimes leave too much of a "grey" area. Although overall I'd acknowledge it a positive core value, it does have its downside.

headline: Great company to work for
pros: Flexible hours, room to grow, great returning customers, fun environment.
cons: Some managers choose favorites, but that happens anywhere. Luckily the company has adopted more corporate standards.

headline: Working experience
pros: You get to try different types of food in the store so that you can explain to your customers.
cons: Work is very intense.

headline: Mate
pros: Great 'family' atmosphere amongst our team.
cons: Hard work / life balance.

headline: Part-Time Crew Member
pros: Coworkers made 8 hour shifts go by quickly. It's entertaining to work here, and there's always something to do. If you ever need any help with something, you can ask another coworker and everyone makes the environment welcoming and easy going even though the store is always busy and fast paced.
cons: Felt like I did not get enough training when I started, but it's easy to catch on and learn with the help of staff.

headline: The Golden Handcuffs
pros:
Great work environment 
Amazing benefits
Great people to work with
cons:
Hard to move up into management
Pay is average for grocery but not great for full-time work
Stores run independently from the mother ship.

headline: Life At Trader Joe's
pros: Such a wonderfully supportive company. We are all treated with respect, positively acknowledged for all we contribute to the success of the company. We love our customers and want them to have a WOW customer experience when in our stores. Our customers are our family. All crew feels like they are in one big, happy family and we share the LOVE.
cons: I have not experienced any.

headline: Crew Member
pros: They treat you like a real person
cons: The mgmt tends to pick their favorites

headline: Great work place
pros:
Great management/ crew
Fantastic benefits
Discounts on delicious food!
cons: None, great people to work with.

headline: Crew Member/ Artist
pros: Great benefits, flexible with scheduling, positive environment, understanding managers, fair pay, raise opportunities
cons: lack of specialization and opportunities to move up the ladder

headline: Crew
pros: benefits, rate of pay, flexibility
cons: hard physical work, shifts change daily

headline: Good for retail, but not good enough
pros:
-High pay and good health benefits for retail
-Mostly friendly staff
-401(k)
cons:
-Increasingly too much pressure for what is essentially a minimum wage job
-A high amount of people I know end up permanently injured
-Decreasingly fun to go to work over the last several years
-Although pay is good for retail, still need another job to supplement pay

headline: Crew Member
pros: Excellent staffing, fun work environment, GREAT benefits
cons: Inconsistent schedule, not guaranteed hours

headline: Lots of energy but they try to make you drink the Kool-aid
pros: Great people to work with great food fun atmosphere on the floor. Pay and benefits are decent. There's a lot to learn.
cons: Management can be a bit intense almost like slavedrivers. Mandatory overtime during holidays. Management always makes you feel replaceable. Some customers are nasty and act entitled.

headline: Mate
pros: Great place to work, with amazing benefits!
cons: It's very physical work - unexpected for some.

headline: Excellent Company Culture
pros: Excellent work environment. Very customer service oriented and makes sure to take care of their workers. There really is a reason for their cult status among fans.
cons: Can't think of any. Obviously not everyone in that large of an organization can be perfect, but at the end of the day the culture is fantastic.

headline: Quirky- just a bit
pros:
Great co-workers
Lots of tasty food to try
Outstanding benefits
Good raises when given a good review
cons: hours can be rough when you have open availability but seniority helps

headline: warehouse worker, forklift operator, pallet jack operator
pros: nice laid back atmosphere, good people
cons: low pay, hard to get hired in

headline: Great job
pros: Salary is great for most of the work being done
cons: It is hard to move up the chain, and the labor can be intense.

headline: Crew Member
pros: Trader Joe's is a fantastic company to work for, not only is the entire crew genuine and caring people, but the pay rate is great. I have made plenty of friends, go to know lots of regulars by name, and overall have enjoyed my experience.
cons: One of the problems is that since the crew is so tight-nit, I have seen many relationships form in the workplace and it can cause major problems.

headline: Great place to work while in school
pros:
Fun Environment
Food/Wine Tastings
Great Managers-Depending on Store
Fun Crew
Great Benefits
cons: Can be hard on the body

headline: Best Job
pros: Great corporate culture, excellent benefits, good pay, fun environment.
cons: I suppose we could get paid a little more?  But that would be it, really.

headline: Fantastic company to work for
pros: Staying fit. The duties switch often to avoid repetitive stress injuries. Very social work environment. The benefits are very very good. The pay is good for the work. Frequent raises. Employee tastings. The company is fiscally responsible and uses recyclable materials whenever possible. Employee discount. More autonomy than most jobs.
cons: The hours are erratic. Trying to have a routine is basically impossible. The work is both physically and mentally exhausting. Customers can be incredibly condescending.

headline: Mate
pros: Some cool people work there
cons: Hours, Salary, bad management, immature coworkers, annoying customers

headline: Crew member section leader
pros: Customer service and your co workers
cons: Hard labor especially working dry

headline: Hourly Crew Member
pros:
Great Environment! Wonderful Management team that appreciates your hard work and also works just as hard as hourly crew members.
Puts employee happiness and Customer service as priority
cons: Although we all enjoy our jobs and have fun, it is still a grocery store and requires demanding physical work. But we are well compensated for the work done compared to other grocery stores

headline: It can be Fun at times to work there, but also challenging with all the differing management styles.
pros: Friendly atmosphere&relaxed attire.  Food knowledge+Samples. Job is completely trainable&easy to learn. TJ's hires for personality, because that cannot be taught.  Outgoing coworkers.
cons: No job ever able to be finished, poor communication.  Direction comes from top-->down, logic&reasoning is lost in transit.  A whole Lot of wasteful work and re-work.

headline: Changing for the worse.
pros:
Fun environment and sense of teamwork
Good pay
Encouraged to take on responsibilities and move up
cons:
The pro's listed above are no more!
Managers need to be reevaluated
No accountability

headline: Amazaing workplace
pros: Environment was very comfortable and enjoyed the job!
cons: Wish I could've worked more!

headline: Crewmember
pros:
Great atmosphere in the store
Usually working with friendly people
Tastings for product knowledge
Dental/vision/health coverage
Schedule is diverse; usually doing cashiering, stocking, cleaning throughout the day
Chance for a raise every 6 months
cons:
Customers can be a pain
Can become monotonous after a while
On feet all day

headline: Customer Service
pros: Great working environment, healthcare, bi yearly reviews
cons: Hours cut conistently and never a set schedule

headline: An okay job
pros: You do a wide variety of tasks, culture is decently compassionate/not about overworking you or making it a super spartan environment
cons: You are subject to manager approval and are still working in a grocery store

headline: TJs is great
pros: good raises, benefits and atmosphere
cons: A little disorganized at times

headline: Crew member
pros: Great pay and benefits. Able to be passionate about great food and share that with customers. Makes the normal task of grocery shopping a memorable experience.
cons: Very physically demanding, not your average 9-5 hours.

headline: Trader Joe's
pros: Great health insurance, relaxed environment, good management
cons: Pay is too low to have as an only job for new employees

headline: Great Comapny
pros: PTO, Employees, Various shifts to work
cons: 50 hours a week, Hard to fire lazy emplyees, Morning shifts

headline: As retail jobs go, it's the best possible
pros: Company culture is amazing. There is very little hierarchy within the store, and the company usually promotes internally, which means that the managers understand the job you're doing and often are right there doing it with you. Pay and benefits are awesome, of course. You get reviewed every six months, and unless you've done something awful, you're all but guaranteed a $0.60 raise or more.
cons: Shift work. Like any retail store, they need more people in the afternoons/evenings and on the weekends, so you're likely to be working when everyone else is sleeping and sleeping when everyone else is working. It's not really conducive to hanging out with anyone other than other retail employees. Day shifts are available, but they're generally given to the people who have been with the company longest.

headline: Mate
pros: Good Benefits, Pay, Team Oriented
cons: Schedule, Quality of Life, Physical, Understaffed

headline: Best Company To Work For
pros: Good benefits, fun atmosphere, good team and good customers. It's a dream job.
cons: Are you kidding me?! NONE!

headline: Great opportunity!
pros: Trader Joe's has an excellent "team-based" environment. I felt like I was an important part of that team and my own attitude and achievements reflected back on Trader Joe's during my time there.
cons: The labor (especially when closing) is difficult. I felt like shifts were not spread out across employees so some had only very easy morning/day shifts and others, such as myself, were stuck closing late into the night lifting very heavy boxes.

headline: Great Company
pros:
- insanely good benefits
- relaxed and cheerful environment
- varied workload for all employees
- little to no bureaucracy
cons:
- difficult upward mobility
- huge gap between entry level expectations/hours and next-level/management expectations/hours
- raises are easy and fixed so there's little incentive to work harder or take on more responsibilities

headline: Teamwork Oriented
pros: Great and like-minded coworkers, good management (no micromanaging)
cons: sporadic shifts, no raise in pay for additional responsibilities

headline: Friendly Coworkers / Good place to work
pros:
Good pay
Nice work culture
Friendly coworkers
cons: Don't be an out of shape fatty you'll be moving around alot.

headline: Not bad
pros: This company tends to hire really wonderful people. You will make friends here and have fun working most of the time.
cons: The company is starting to become more and more corporate leaving a huge disconnect between managers and crew members. This completely changed the energy of the store I worked in.

headline: Good
pros: Pay works similarly to costco
cons:
Work/life balance
Not as flexible as other trader joes in terms of career opportunities

headline: Great pay
pros: Pay is great for this position
cons: The parking lot is small

headline: A frustrating experience
pros: Some good products. Some very nice and supportive crew members. If it's to be a first job Traders would be a good place to get experience. A somewhat decent benefits package, but only if you've never had a job, otherwise it's just fair. My advice is if Traders is a first time job, get your experience and move on to something better. Don't make a career out of it unless that is your only goal.
cons: Quite a lot actually. I say this with the understanding that there are probably some decent Trader Joe stores out there but my experience at West Hollywood California was a mixed bag. No consistency to management, which is the norm apparently, favoritism from the managers to certain crew members, constantly cutting peoples hours, over hiring so crew has less days a week to work and an over abundance of captains who have a spotty record at best with the company who continue to have careers with no apparent discipline from the company. A very weak management platform. A continued focus of hiring people with low education levels.

headline: crew
pros: have fun and  work with great people
cons: it is a corporate job - our fantastic health insurance was destroyed by Obama care and that was a tragedy

headline: trader joes
pros: great benefits and place to work
cons: I have nothing bad to say about this company at all

headline: Great Company to work for if you like working for the public.
pros: Food, flexible work hours, work hard but have fun doing it, retirement plan, paid vacation. They listen and take care of their employees.
cons: It is not a glamorous job, but someone's got to do it. If you don't like customer service, this job is not for you!

headline: Crew Member
pros: Great co-workers, friendly atmosphere, competitive pay, room for advancement
cons: No place to go if you have an issue, managers support each other not staff, there is a ton favoratism, discount could be better, customers are ALWAYS right

headline: Full-time crew member
pros: Yearly raises, good benefits, nice people
cons: It's retail. You work nights, weekends, and holidays.

headline: Favorite Job
pros: The management is great. They treat you really well and are very fair. The pay is also really good for barely doing much work.
cons: It is very difficult to become a manager there. It's the only time the politics really come into play.

headline: Pretty good employer
pros: Good work environment, good benefits.
cons: Dealing with the public--rude customers.

headline: mate
pros: excellent pay and benefits.  two consecutive days off per week and a company that knows you by name
cons: hours are hard and you must be able to multitask at all times.  Standards sometimes are way too high

headline: Mate
pros: Great benefit package, great retirement package, company has a pretty good paid time off package. Company does care about its crew members. Keeps a very engaged work force
cons: The worst schedule of any retailer I know. Having to work a year or more without getting a scheduled weekend day off is not very family friendly.  Then if you do request a day other then your normal scheduled dsys off having to lose a days pay is not fair.

headline: Co Workers
pros:
The best part about working at Trader Joe's is that they hire based on the stores current employees so everyone gets along. 
Amazing benefits. I'm only part time so I get dental and vision but a FT will get health and a gym membership. 
Good. Food.
cons: It's a very physical job, if you get hurt on the job you better find something else. Their workers compensation insurance is awful, not to mention they will schedule you less if you are a transitional worker.

headline: Crew
pros:
Great place to work
Great benefits
cons: Customer service is not fun

headline: Mostly positive
pros: Their flexibility with your schedule and the nice coworkers
cons: Working weekends and unstable schedule

headline: Mate
pros: Great co-workers, fun fast-paced environment. Good compensation and benefits for retail.
cons: Tough work-life balance to maintain. 10 hour days with a descending schedule make it difficult to do much that is meaningful after your shift is done.

headline: Great company
pros: Easy growth in company and friendly staff are inviting and fun to work with
cons: Takes a long time to move up

headline: It's okay
pros: You get to eat a lot of samples
cons: The most is 35 hours

headline: Seriously Great Company
pros: Good Benefits, friendly atmosphere, variety of work, good communication with supervisors and a seriously happy workplace.
cons: It is still an hourly position unless you are a mate or captain, so hours will be inconsistent at times. However, they are open about working around school schedules if you are in school or need to work part time for whatever outside things are happening in your life. It can be a bit hectic and overwhelming during the holidays, but there is a good "were in this together" mentality from the whole team.

headline: Fast paced environment good for positive people
pros:
Job is seldom boring.
Chance to turn it into a career over time.
Friendly customers for the most part.
cons:
Some long-term employees tend to gripe about management.
Change in performance evaluation process a few years back makes climbing to top of pay scale take a lot longer.
Once you rise to high pay rate can experience the dreaded "golden handcuffs".

headline: Was FT and now stuck at PT
pros:
Legitimately one of the best retail jobs you can get in Houston. I've worked a lot of sales and retail gigs in the past, as well as non-profit campaigning, and this place is at the top of my list.

Great benefits, laid-back (for the most part) management, and a great rotation system keeps the job from feeling too redundant. Also, depending on your Captain (store manager) the music will either put you to sleep or have you jamming out. My offer was around what most of my previous jobs paid me, but they apparently don't start everyone above $10/hr by default. The offer was very fair based on my previous experience. They will feed you in some way...everyday. lol
cons:
Some employees are very passive-aggressive. 

Some of the management come off as though they aren't fully-qualified for their positions.

You might wind up needing to get a second job during the slower seasons because of how badly they cut the hours. 

Depending on how they schedule you, there might not be any opportunity for you to go to school at reasonable hours or have a decent social life.

headline: Nice
pros: Nice place to work all the time.
cons: Pay too much money for little work.

headline: Great people
pros: The crew is a fun and diverse group that works as a team.
cons: You must have weekend availability.

headline: Great Experience
pros: Great communal/team attitude among coworkers. Mates were always receptive to crew member ideas, criticisms, and kept and open dialogue on what their expectations were. Was a great entry level job and provided great experience.
cons: Limited to part time unless you are a Mate (Manager) so there are certain limitations to the position. They do provide opportunity to grow and are very flexible though.

headline: Disappointed
pros:
Pay was decent
started me at 14.00 as I had a lot of experience with dealing with people and customers
cons:
I had read so much about Trader Joe's and what a fabulous place it was to work and was so happy and excited to be part of their team.
I was really disappointed though when I started working there.
I'm sure that there are fabulous stores and wont hold the entire company responsible for me getting stuck in a store that I felt had bad managers. 
They were disorganized, played favorites, did NOT listen to me when I would till them where my 'strengths were and how I could add 'value'.  
Some managers were more like drill Sargent and talked down to you.
Overall just plain disappointed and actually didn't like going to work.

headline: Crew Member
pros: The people are great and it is an awesome environment!
cons: No cons associated with Trader Joe's

headline: Crew
pros: Relaxed environment to work in.
cons: Some Managers play favorites with their employees.

headline: Great Job
pros:
Flexible schedule 
Great college job 
friendly people
cons:
Heavy work 
Boring during slow times 
Repetitive work

headline: Adopting the corporate greed model
pros: A small employee discount. Customers often enjoy shopping in the store.
cons: I've worked for this company for many years as a crew member. Unfortunately,  nepotism has always been an element for the employees to be aware of. I was lucky to be on the good side of management for many years but that changed with a new store manager and a management team that followed suit. Many employees in my store have experienced unfair and biased reviews, especially the older employees. Lot's of decent employees fired or "encouraged" to leave the company so as to move in newer, younger cheaper employees. I've also watched decent employees go for years without a raise because they did good jobs but were not in the "favored" circle with management. It used to be the employees were genuinely happy at the stores, but now the smiles and small talk are there due to fear. Checkout counters have been minimized to increase intimacy with customers but to cut down on ergonomics and safety for both employees and customers. It used to be employees strengths were considered when placing them in different departments of the store, but this has fallen by the wayside in the name of cross training. So if you want to feel special this is not the place unless you become managements little star by sacrificing your sanity to do everything imaginable in the store. A new atmosphere of competition has also been set up so expect to fight like a pigeon for what little hours are tossed down from management. The scheduling system is on the dayforce app and employees can now forget about any personal considerations when it comes to their schedule and hours. Your sick pay will be bundled with your vacation pay as "absence reserve" so if you get sick...forget about that vacation you had planned. Employees are encouraged to even donate their absence reserve to employees who experience hardships. Really? I would think this company could dig a little deeper themselves to help employees in need. An insult to pawn it off their "peasants". This company uses the term "Kaizen" to to represent their values. Sorry to say this has proven to me to not be the case.

headline: I feel like I should be there foe the whole day
pros:
Everyone working at Trader joe's are connected and are like a family. I always see smiling and happy working mates, crew members, very friendly captain wow. 
I am happy, all crews are happy, our customers will be happy that makes my day useful and beautiful.
cons: Nothing i have to say at this time

headline: Crew Lead
pros: Fun environment, discount, great benefits good pay and products speak for themselves.
cons: Managers can be new so you have to go thru the learning curve.

headline: Great Food, Fun Place to Work, Unique Co-Workers
pros: Great products without artificial preservatives or GMOs. Employee discount is 10%. Fantastic benefits for part-timers (all crew members are hourly part time employees) based on average number of hours worked in a qualifying period. Tasks are varied and employees are cross-trained to work in any position. Never a dull moment during your shift. FREE SAMPLES!
cons: Many things can go wrong during the day (product doesn't arrive leaving an empty space on the shelf, equipment malfunctions, customer drops a case of wine, etc.)so you need to be FLEXIBLE in your attitude. Scheduling is done based on sales per person per hour and if the store sales are "off" your hours will be cut.

headline: Crew Member
pros: Great coworkers, great management, great food. I loved working here.
cons: Very busy location, but that's all.

headline: Poor Management unprofessionalism and special treatment for certian employees
pros: The doo try to take car of their customers
cons: There are too much nepotism, employees who are dating, living together or married get the same shifts together, and the same days off and if you act wacky and have tattoos, a drug user, alcoholic, bisexual, gay or you look like a person off the streets you will fit right in.

headline: Good leaders, mostly good teams
pros: Kind and interesting people and a popular product
cons: Negative employees can drag down morale

headline: Not the best not the worst
pros: Don't get me wrong I love it here and it is a great environment to work here. If you have no other qualifications to do something else they are amazing. Great room for moving up in the company, every six months you can get a raise and it is really easy to get health insurance, dental and vision that the company provides. Great working around your schedule as well.
cons: I have had issues with the management being way to unprofessional and inappropriate and any sort of conflict that comes up is never really dealt with.

headline: Overall good company
pros: Great community of people, both employees and customers. Benefits, 10% discount on products, and you get to try all the new products.
cons: Management can be irregular and not all managers have your best interest at heart.

headline: Better communication
pros: Clean store friendly work place great discounts
cons: Not enough hours an long term employee get better treatment

headline: Like Family
pros: Friendly crew. Fun times. Nice clientele.
cons: Lots of lifting and difficult parking situation.

headline: Awesome company takes care of you
pros: Kaizen, cares for you, competitive yet team oriented
cons: Not too many- cliquish people, some drama kings/queens

headline: good job for the most part
pros: greta place to make friends and meet new people.
cons: Management has changed a lot in the couple years.  Benefits have been cut...

headline: Crew member
pros:
- If you have any problem, the mate team and Captain- Jenn are more than willing to sit down and assist you with your issues. 
- The crew consists of real people, of all walks of life, education, and interests- Artists, Physician Assistants, Musicians, Comedians, Veterans, and Sustainable food system's educated
cons:
- The line between having a good time and being professional gets blurred often, and that sounds fun, but it's pretty out of hand at TJs, and I kinda love it, I know that it causes stress to others. 
-  The customers deserve to be treated with respect, as employees of Trader Joe's we want to be treated with respect as well, don't treat us like we're scum on the bottom of your shoe.  We're humans.

headline: A job to wine about!
pros:
Employees get health care and 401k from day one!
Everyone gets to participate in food sampling (and wine sampling) to better engage with the products
Employees are encouraged to think of new and innovative ways to use products and get to showcase them at monthly food fairs
Huge emphasis placed on good employee culture, as shown by yearly outings and little perks here and there.
cons: Hard on the arms, very physical job (not so much a con as a warning, this ain't for the faint of heart)

headline: crewmember
pros:
working with a great group of people
benefits... really exceptional
cons:
schedule.. crazy hours
customer service part can really be taxing

headline: Great Choice for Job or Career
pros: Tops in retail salary/benefits, flexible with changing availability for students, etc., friendly atmosphere, team environment, and many locations across the country for those who need or want to move.
cons: It's retail, so at least one weekend day is a must. We're known for our customer service so some customers take advantage of that.

headline: Trader Joes Queens, NY
pros:
-Decent pay for retail (usally starts 9-11/hr) caps at about 20
-Benefits
-Food discount (10 percent)
-Tasty food
-Food tastings, outside of demo, for crew members
-Raises every 6 months (about .60)
-Break up work with hourly log
-awesome customers, co-workers, and mates
-Hiring process is very fast and direct
cons:
-The scheduling is horrible. Its randomly generated so there is no consistency. You can work 7 days in a row sometimes. Sometimes you may have to work late to come back early. Hour ranges from 4 am (earliest) to 2 am (latest), so that is a lot of variety.
-Not sure why my store has some people with consistent schedules but others will lose hours if the change availability.
-Some people can be working half as much but paid twice as much.
-Apparently you can't wear gloves in the store even though its retail and it involves a warehouse. CEO Dan came in to the store and thought it wasn't a "good look" .
-Since Trader Joes is a supermarket with a name customers can come with high expectations and egos
-Mates work long shifts and they can also be back to back (late one day, early next day)
-Despite work being broken up its retail and repetitive
-Weekends can be really crowded   
-Supply methods, lots of seasonal items, even basic stuff like yeast.
-Hire Mates from outside 
-Very physical, expected but becomes a deal when you got to work back to back shifts.

headline: Manager
pros: I've squired so many useful tools that I can use in work and every day life.
cons: Not much time with my new born child and miss out on a lot of family stuff

headline: Crew Member
pros: I really enjoyed my time working for Trader Joe's. The best part of working there is the people you work with. Everyone is friendly and easy going. And food tastings are great!
cons: They pay was okay, but as a crew member, not much above minimum wage. But definitely room to grow with the company if you are a loyal employee.

headline: Manager
pros: Great concept and products.  Great Colleagues!
cons: Use to stand for a lot.  TJ's has sold out to corporate culture.

headline: Great Company
pros: Family oriented and fun. Highly recommended.
cons: Nothing to say, hard work pays off.

headline: Not all it crack up to be
pros: The raise the bar as far as Customer Service is concern. Definitely gives the Wow shopping experience.
cons: Very cliquey some of the Supervisor are personal friends and the favoritism is out of control, not fair.

headline: It's all about the "bottom line"
pros: Flexible hours, great co-workers, above average part-time pay, good for students and short-time employment.
cons: Not the company it used to be. Very physical job. The company cut back or eliminated many of the benefits TJ's was known for. Health insurance is much harder to qualify for and easy to lose coverage altogether. To advance, work hours are ungodly - late night shifts, followed by early morning shifts wreck havoc with one's sleep cycles. A lot of favoritism.

headline: Crew Member
pros: Fun environment, always busy, great team players.
cons: Better pay, sometimes more hours needed.

headline: Good job while looking for a career
pros: Great people, good overall vibe
cons: Didn't pay enough, can hurt your back from lifting

headline: Fun work enviroment
pros: Always wanted to feel like one of the home team come work at trader joes. At least that was how I felt when I was working there. Took several days from the initial meet and greets to get a positive vibe on everyone but it was very fun and enjoyable.
cons: Long hours and short breaks.

headline: Crew Member
pros: The flexible schedule was great, managers were very kind, the customers are fun to talk to. I enjoyed every day working at Trader Joes. Health care benefits are great!
cons: The work can be really tiring! Stocking things all day can be difficult work and customer requests get pretty old.

headline: Crew Member
pros: Fast-pace, simple work, raises every 6 months
cons: Customers can be undermining, hires management from outside, manual labor

headline: Mate
pros: Trader Joe's is a great company to work for...Low stress, humanizing environment, and a place where the work does not come home with me.  Benefits are amazing!
cons: The pay scale is interesting.  I manage a little over 80 people in my store, and many of them make more per hour than me.  I was given 18% increase in pay when I was promoted from crew.  I was making $12.50 per hour before my promotion.  It is taking me more time than I thought to be in a financially stable position.  It has been a taxing couple of years for me.

headline: Crew Member
pros: Benefits, co-workers, work environment, and customers
cons: Limited opportunities for growth, upper management, work schedule.

headline: alright work place
pros: The people I worked with were nice people and unique. They are pretty flexible with your work schedule.
cons: Having to work until midnight. Also, it's a pretty tough physical job having to constantly stock and open boxes, cut down boxes, extreme heavy lifting.

headline: Crew member
pros: Great health care and vision plan.
cons: It is a retail job.

headline: Good Store
pros: awesome company, good pay, amazing products i could really stand behind, and a positive work environment
cons: it's retail, which brings along it's own set of challenges because some customers are ridiculous to be honest

headline: Ok part-time job
pros: Raise every 6 months, Decent co-workers,food tastings
cons: Small cramp work environment,repetitive physical work, difficulty scheduling, management plays favoritism, bougie-ass customers.

headline: An amazing opportunity to gain a rounded knowledge of all aspects of a retail company.
pros: The hours are good if your work ethic is. Management is usually very accommodating to personal issues inside and outside of work.
cons: There are no large cons to this job, if you do the job well then the job will do you well in turn.

headline: Loved the job and then I was seriously mistreated and fired for a ridiculous reason
pros: Flexible hours for crew members who have other jobs or school in the larger stores. Pay rate is higher than most retail jobs. Good benefits.
cons: Managers are spread too thin and work a fifty hour week. Very hard to have family or personal time with that kind if schedule. They always change operations in order to improve service etc. Sometimes this just created chaos. If it's not broken, don't try to fix it

headline: Organic Grocery store??
pros:
Good pay
Learn skills by moving around to different departments
Having to comment on everything a customer is buying
cons: Management was not on the same page with one another about store policy's

headline: Outstanding Company With Great Values
pros: You get great benefits if you work over 30 hours a week which is really great since I've never had health insurance until now. You have the opportunity to earn two raises a year based on performance. Friendly coworkers between the crew, mates, and captain. The company has great values towards meeting customer expectations and ensuring a wow experience every time by hiring bubbly, fun people while maintaining a stocked, clean, and organized store.
cons: Using Dayforce HCM can be a little annoying at times, and some coworkers can get away with slacking off so others have to work harder to make up for it to complete tasks in a timely manner.

headline: Crew Member
pros: It's a fun, laid back work environment with fun people and good benefits.
cons: From what I can tell the company is poorly managed in the region I currently work in. They have a big problem with the high turn over rate and competing with the upcoming new minimum wage increase in January 2017.

headline: Crew member
pros: A great company that's fair and flexible.  Captain and mates are outstanding.  Raises twice a year.  Below normal cost for insurance.
cons: You need to maintain your hours above ( average ) 30 hours a week for health insurance/dental/vision insurance.  20 hours for just dental/vision ( free. ) You earn a "bank " of hours for sick time/vacation to use.  That's more than fair.

headline: A great place to work and the people are amazing,they are very flexible and  the Mate is always polite
pros: Love the energy, people are amazing and love that it's flexible and they give you a chance to be in an area where you are the best,offer bagel and muffin to opening shift ,morning shift work as a team,although I am part time I get 7.5 per day love this place best place I work for a longest time
cons: Some people work harder than other ,don't pay on holidays and don't have vacation time only ar hours and the people who works there for years are lazy

headline: Great place to work for college students.
pros: Decent pay and flexible hours, which works well for college students trying to have a job alongside a full class schedule.
cons: Can be physically demanding, there is a lot of lifting to be done that is shared among the team, so be careful!

headline: Great Place!
pros: Loved working at TJ's. It was a fun atmosphere with lots of positive, upbeat people.
cons: The pay was rather low and the hours were quite irregular. Scheduling was pretty difficult.

headline: Crew Member
pros: Very good work environment - Lot of fun and a lot of variety in job duties.  Get to work delivering customer service to a variety of customers, good and bad.
cons: Some of the crew would rather lull around than do their share all the time.  But then, there are these types of employees in every company.

headline: Crew Member
pros: Flexible hours, decent pay, very social workplace, discount on groceries (10%), lots of physical exercise
cons: Trader jOes has gone corporate.  Everything is about the almighty dollar.  You are just a "body" that does work.  They will mask it with the fun side of TJs but you are just a person doing an hourly job.  You will work very hard and be quite tired due to all the work you will do.  Lots of bs to the customers "How was your day".  They won't protect you from the crazies that come in.  Try to find a store that has a good environment to work.  Each "captain" is his own dictator and they could be cool or a jerk.  Beware.

headline: Working at Queens,NY Trader Joe's
pros: Okay pay and great benefits
cons: If managers have a problem with you they take it out on you, your hours are cut I literally mean it can go from 40 hours a week to less then 16 hours a week ! They can put you on carts everyday it can be raining or snowing your put out there for a whole hour!! The management staff does nothing while the crew members does everything! I work in Queens, NY at 557 and when I say my captain is the worst she is the worst, she puts individuals down, she have favoritism certain people who hours never get cut or they can take as many on the clock breaks as they want. Their never on carts. We have the worst captain she has her own rules , every transfer employee says this when they come.

headline: Crew member
pros: Great pay! 2 raises a year, good benefits, good people.
cons: Repetitive work, wears on your body.

headline: Crew Member
pros:
-Working with nothing but awesome people
-Always on your feet, never a dull moment
-Great benefits, raises every 6 months
-Flexible work schedule
cons:
-Not much chance to move up unless you want to work 50 hours a week with way more responsibility for not that much more money
-If you want to work M-F/9-5, this isn't the job for you
-Some of the management gets caught up in micromanaging
-Crew members don't have too much responsibility when it comes to the grand scheme of things

headline: good
pros: I enjoyed working there a lot so that is nice hahahah it was good
cons: I can't think of any cons at this very moment. Good day.

headline: Crew Member
pros:
Awesome People
Flexible Hours
Food Tastings
Good Pay
cons:
No overtime
Writing an order can be stressful

headline: Unfair
pros: Enjoy the customers and our ever evolving new products.
cons: As a crew member with a family, upset that my performance is based upon the hours that i cannot give, which unfortunately have to flexible at times, instead of what I am doing when I am at work and if their are concerns for my performance then give us time to fix these concerns before the reviews are written.

headline: No longer the great Trader Joe's it once was.
pros: Slightly better than working for safeway
cons: They don't care about their employees. They don't care if you injure yourself, they'll try and throw it under the rug if they can. Most of the managers are terrible, and don't fulfill their responsibilities. Register time is divided unfairly. Same people get placed in the same tasks every day. They frown upon 'micro breaking' as slacking off, some people need to stretch.

headline: When it comes to working retail or grocery you will have a hard time finding a better company to work for.
pros: Great environment to work in, able to transfer locations. Raises based on performance rather than seniority and no Union!  You are in the end treated fairly by a large company, it's not perfect but it's better than most.
cons: It is a physically demanding job, it is retail so you can have negative interactions with the public. Hours can be cut because of the economy/sales

headline: Fun and vibrant environment!
pros:
*Collaboration
*Motivation
*Great place to work as a college student and beyond
*Fun place to learn about the customers
cons: -Depending on the hours worked, the rush could be quite large and that was frustrating. But that's the deal with any sort of grocery store or customer facing business.

headline: Overall a good place to work!
pros: Amazing people. Very little bureaucracy. Good pay, excellent benefits.  They do an upwards review every year so your crew can review your performance.... it is extremely helpful in growing your management style and abilities. Overall, they treat their employees very well!  Executive management is good, they have a great sense of why people love Trader Joes and every change they make is centered on making the company better.
cons: Poor work/life balance for Mates.  The descending schedule (start with closing shifts the beginning of the week and end with opening shifts at the end of your week) is hard.  During your work week you only have time to eat, sleep and work.  It's a physically demanding job, not bad for a few years but will take a toll on your body over time.

headline: Great Job, wish it had worked out!
pros: Great crew! Great Products! Awesome environment!
cons: Not enough hours for me to be eligible for benefits while maintaining my family schedule!

headline: Mate
pros: Great work environment, good people, competitive pay and time-off. 401k is great and the health care is top notch.
cons:
Tough to work in a Private company setting while attempting a "No Bureaucracy" approach.
Uncertainty of advancement opportunities at work.

headline: Customer service specialist
pros: Great culture, people and environment to work.
cons: Job is very challenging for the body.

headline: Mate
pros: Great atmosphere! Everyone is pulling for the same goal! very well managed!
cons: Work you to the bone,lots of manual labor and hard work with managing time to the T.

headline: I loved my time at Trader Joe's
pros: It's a fantastic work environment. The company treats its employees respectfully, and they do a good job of keeping the work varied so you're not doing the same thing for eight hours. They care about both their customers and their employees.
cons: Most of the shifts are either morning (5/6 am or earlier until 1 pm or so) or evening (2/3pm until 10/11pm), which can make a social life outside of work somewhat difficult.

headline: Fading fast
pros: Friendly team members, open management style, varied tasks, fantastic customer base. Trader Joe's is still one of the best places to work retail...however, that is changing.
cons:
Health Insurance. Sorry, TJ's, but you messed that one up big time. We all once qualified for healthcare at 20 hours average per week. That changed about 2 1/2 years ago when the requirement was moved to 30 hours per week. For those of us who work in slower markets or who have summer slow downs, it has meant that we can no longer depend on your company for our livelihood. Employees that want to work 30 hours can't due to slower business and as a result are pushed out of the insurance and into the marketplace which for my family will cost twice as much as it does through the company for comparable insurance.
